name: 4-nhac-2266-tetrame-piperidin-n-oxide
Reason: 4-Nhac-2266-tetrame-piperidin-n-oxide has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The piperidine ring introduces rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The oxo group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of four phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
